name: Goris Geological Museum
description: {'Information': ['The Goris Geological Museum is located in the town of Goris, Armenia. It is dedicated to showcasing the geological history of the region, with a particular focus on the unique rock formations and minerals found in the area.', 'The museum plays a vital role in educating visitors about the geological history of Goris and Armenia. It highlights the region’s rich natural resources and the geological processes that have shaped the landscape over millions of years.'], 'Key Features': ['Collections of minerals, fossils, and rocks.', 'Educational displays about local geology and natural resources.', 'Information on tectonic activity and landscape formation.', 'Interesting geological specimens from different time periods.'], 'Visiting Tips': ['Spend time reading the detailed displays to understand the local geology.', 'Ideal for those interested in earth sciences and natural history.']}
short_description: A museum showcasing the geological history of Goris, with exhibits on rocks, minerals, and the region's natural formations.

name: Saint Gregory the Illuminator Church (Goris)
description: {'Information': ['Saint Gregory the Illuminator Church is located in Goris, Armenia, and is one of the notable landmarks in the region. The church is dedicated to Saint Gregory the Illuminator, the patron saint of Armenia who is credited with converting Armenia to Christianity in the early 4th century.', 'The church holds significant religious value as it is dedicated to Saint Gregory, the founder of the Armenian Apostolic Church. It represents Armenia’s deep Christian roots and its historical role in the spread of Christianity in the Caucasus region.'], 'Key Features': ['Traditional Armenian architectural style.', 'Beautiful frescoes and intricate stone carvings.', 'Peaceful and serene surroundings.', 'Views of the surrounding landscapes.'], 'Visiting Tips': ['Respect the religious customs when visiting the church.', 'Wear modest clothing, as it is a place of worship.', 'Spend some time exploring the church and its surroundings.']}
short_description: A beautiful Armenian church dedicated to Saint Gregory, offering a peaceful retreat and a glimpse into Armenia’s Christian heritage.

name: Tatev Monastery
description: {'Information': ['Located near Goris, Tatev Monastery is one of Armenia’s most famous and historical monasteries.', 'Dates back to the 9th century and played a significant role in the cultural and spiritual life of the region.'], 'Key Features': ['Stunning architecture, panoramic views, and a cable car ride from Halidzor.'], 'Visiting Tips': ['Take the Wings of Tatev cable car for a scenic view of the surrounding landscape.']}
short_description: A historic monastery set in breathtaking surroundings.

name: Aksel Bakunts House Museum
description: {'Information': ['The Aksel Bakunts House Museum is located in Goris, Armenia, and is dedicated to the life and work of Aksel Bakunts, a prominent Armenian writer and intellectual. The museum is housed in the building where Bakunts spent his later years.', 'Aksel Bakunts was an influential figure in Armenian literature, known for his novels, short stories, and essays that often focused on social issues, the struggles of common people, and the national identity of Armenia. The museum offers insights into his personal life and literary contributions.'], 'Key Features': ['Personal belongings of Aksel Bakunts.', 'Manuscripts and original works of the writer.', "Photographs and letters related to Bakunts' life.", "Restored rooms reflecting the writer's living conditions."], 'Visiting Tips': ['Allocate time to read the informative displays in both Armenian and English.', 'Check the museum’s hours as they may vary seasonally.', 'Combine the visit with a tour of other cultural sites in Goris.']}
short_description: A museum dedicated to Aksel Bakunts, offering a glimpse into his life and literary contributions.

name: Cave City of Goris (Goris Rock Forest)
description: {'Information': ['The Cave City of Goris, also known as the Goris Rock Forest, is a unique natural and historical site. Located in Goris, Armenia, it features a series of ancient cave dwellings carved into towering rock formations.', 'The site dates back to ancient times, with evidence of habitation from as early as the 3rd century. It reflects the traditional cave dwelling culture that existed in the region.'], 'Key Features': ['Rock-hewn dwellings.', 'Natural cave formations.', 'Historical remnants and ruins.', 'Narrow paths leading through the rock formations.'], 'Visiting Tips': ['Visit early to avoid the crowds.', 'Wear comfortable shoes for walking on rocky terrain.', 'Take a guide for a more informative experience.']}
short_description: Ancient cave dwellings set in striking rock formations, offering a glimpse into the past.

name: Armenian National Opera and Ballet Theatre
description: {'information': ['A renowned venue in Yerevan hosting opera, ballet, and classical music performances, named after famous Armenian composers Alexander Spendiaryan and Aram Khachaturian.', 'The People’s House has been a key cultural institution in Armenia since its establishment, honoring the legacy of Armenian musicians.'], 'Key Features': ["World-class performances in opera, ballet, and classical music; home to Armenia's national opera and ballet companies."], 'Visiting Tips': ['Check the event calendar and book tickets early for popular performances.']}
short_description: An iconic cultural center offering high-quality opera and ballet performances in Yerevan.

name: Mosque Jami
description: {'Information:': ['The Jami mosque in Khujand is one of the largest historical mosques in northern Tajikistan and is characterized by its traditional architectural design and is an important religious and cultural center for the city as it has received worshipers and visitors for centuries.'], 'Historical importance:': ['The mosque was built in the sixteenth century, and it is considered one of the most important Islamic landmarks in Khajand.', 'The mosque was a center for teaching religious sciences and the Qur’an, and a place for the meeting of scholars and society.', 'The mosque reflects the traditional Islamic architectural style that combines ornamental bricks with carved wood.'], 'Main Features:': ['A wide courtyard surrounded by the corridors and decorative wooden columns.', 'High minaret provides a panoramic vision for the city.', 'Traditional wooden decorations and a handicraft manual.', "A quiet place for prayer and meditation, with areas intended for children's education.", 'It is located near other landmarks such as Khajnd Castle and Banguchunbi Market.'], 'visiting hours:': ['Open all day, especially during prayer times.', 'It is preferable to visit the mosque outside prayer times for non -Muslims.']}
short_description: The mosque of Khajnd Mosque is a religious and historical teacher dating back to the 16th century, characterized by a traditional Islamic architecture.

name: KOMITAS CHAMBER MUSIC HOUSE
description: {'information': ['A cultural venue in Yerevan dedicated to Armenian music, particularly works by Komitas, a prominent Armenian musicologist and compo', 'Named after Komitas, it serves as a tribute to his contributions to Armenian music and culture.'], 'Key Features': ['Hosts performances of classical and chamber music, exhibitions, and cultural events.'], 'Visiting Tips': ['Check event schedules in advance as performances may require booking.']}
short_description: A cultural hub promoting Armenian classical music and Komitas’ legacy.

name: Kamal khujandi statue
description: {'Information:': ['The statue of Kamal Khajndi is a memorial for the famous Sufi and Persian poet Kamal Al -Din Khojandi, who was born in the city of Khajnd in the fourteenth century. The statue embodies the importance of this poet in the literary and cultural heritage of Tajikistan and the Persian world.'], 'Historical importance:': ['Kamal Khajndi is considered one of the greatest Persian Sufi spinning poets.', 'His poems were full of Sufi love and spiritual meanings, and it has a great influence on Persian and Tajik literature.', 'The statue commemorates the memory of this poet, who contributed to spreading a culture of love and peace through his poems.'], 'Main Features:': ['A bronze statue displays the poet sitting in a position of thinking and contemplating, carrying a poetry collection.', 'It is located in a beautiful area surrounded by gardens and a wide square, making it a quiet place to visit and meditate.', 'A cultural attraction for local visitors and tourists, an ideal location to take memorial photos.', 'Its proximity is to prominent landmarks such as a small museum and the Castle of Kend.'], 'visiting hours:': ['Available to visit at any time, being an open statue in a public square.']}
short_description: Kamal Khujandi Statue honors the great Sufi poet from Khujand in the 14th century.

name: Sughd Region Museum
description: {'Information:': ['Sughd Region Museum is one of the most important cultural and historical landmarks in northern Tajikistan. The museum is located in a beautiful historic building inside the ancient Khujand Fortress and showcases the history and culture of the Sughd region spanning thousands of years.'], 'For historical significance:': ['The museum contains archaeological groups dating back to ancient times, including a small civilization that was part of the Silk Road.', 'The museum displays rare artifacts from the Greek and steam eras, highlighting the role of Khujand as one of the oldest historical cities in Central Asia.', 'The museum documents the history of the development of civilizations that inhabited the region, from ancient times to the modern era, and is an important reference to understand the history and culture of the peoples of Central Asia.'], 'Main Features:': ['More than 1,200 artifacts include old pottery, coins, traditional costumes, and manuscripts.', 'A presentation of popular culture and handicrafts for the Saghad region.', 'Its location in the famous Khajnd Castle, which gives visitors an integrated cultural and historical experience.', 'Panoramic view of the Sir Daraya river from the fences of the castle.', 'The presence of local tourist evidence to explain the history of the exhibits.'], 'working hours:': ['Daily from 9:00 am until 5:00 pm']}
short_description: Sughd Region Museum presents the history and culture of northern Tajikistan in Khujand Fortress.

name: THE TIGRAN PETROSYAN CENTRAL CHESS HOUSE
description: {'information': ['The Tigran Petrosyan Chess House, officially named the Central House of Chess-Player after Tigran Petrosyan, is a prominent chess center located in Yerevan, Armenia. Established in 1970, it serves as the headquarters for the Chess Federation of Armenia and hosts various national and international chess events.'], 'Key Features': ['Designed by architect Zhanna Meshcheryakova, the building features a distinctive triangular shape reminiscent of a chess rook.', 'The facades are adorned with seven copper bas-reliefs depicting stylized chess pieces, emphasizing its thematic focus. A statue of Tigran Petrosyan, crafted by sculptor Ara Shiraz, stands prominently in front of the building, honoring the former World Chess Champion after whom the house is named.'], 'Visiting Tips': ['Address: 50 Khanjyan Street, Kentron District, Yerevan, Armenia.', 'Operating Hours: Open daily from 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM.', 'Contact: For more information or to inquire about events, call +374 10 554 923.']}
short_description: The Tigran Petrosyan Chess House in Yerevan is a hub for chess enthusiasts and events.

name: HRAZDAN CENTRAL STADIUM
description: {'information': ['Hrazdan Stadium is the largest sports venue in Armenia, located in Yerevan. Opened in 1970, it primarily hosts football matches and serves as the home ground for several Armenian football clubs, including Ararat Yerevan and Kilikia Yerevan.', 'Construction and Opening: Constructed between 1969 and 1970 with financial support from the Calouste Gulbenkian Foundation, the stadium was officially opened on November 29, 1970, in the presence of Soviet leader Leonid Brezhnev.', "Capacity and Renovations: Originally accommodating up to 75,000 spectators, the stadium's capacity was later adjusted to 54,208 after renovations in 2008 to install all-seater arrangements."], 'Key Features': ['Notable Events: Hrazdan Stadium has hosted significant matches, including Armenian national team games and club fixtures. One of its most memorable moments was during the Soviet era when Ararat Yerevan faced Bayern Munich in the European Cup quarter-finals, drawing a crowd of 78,000 spectators.'], 'Visiting Tips': ['Address: Athens Street, Kentron District, Yerevan, Armenia.', "Access: The stadium is accessible to the public, with guided tours available upon request. It's advisable to check the official website or contact the stadium administration for tour schedules and ticketing information."]}
short_description: Hrazdan Stadium is Armenia's largest sports venue, hosting football matches and major events.

name: KAREN DEMIRCHYAN SPORTS AND CONCERT COMPLEX
description: {'Location': ['The Karen Demirchyan Sports and Concert Complex, commonly known as "Hamalir," is a prominent venue in Yerevan, Armenia, hosting a variety of sports events, concerts, and cultural performances.', 'Opened in 1983, the complex was named after Karen Demirchyan in 1999 to honor his contributions to Armenian politics and culture. It has undergone several renovations, notably in 2008, enhancing its facilities to meet international standards.'], 'Key Features': ['Main Arena: Accommodates up to 8,800 spectators, hosting major sports events and concerts.', 'Concert Hall: Seats up to 2,040 attendees, featuring high-quality acoustics for musical performances.', 'Additional Facilities: Includes a small sports hall, conference rooms, and exhibition spaces.'], 'Visiting Tips': ['Address: Tsitsernakaberd Hill, 1 Leningradyan Street, Yerevan, Armenia.', "Operating Hours: Varies based on scheduled events; it's advisable to check the official website for specific timings.", 'Contact: For event information and ticketing, call +374 10 399 955 or visit the official website.']}
short_description: The Karen Demirchyan Sports and Concert Complex stands as a cultural and sporting landmark in Yerevan, offering state-of-the-art facilities for a wide range of events.

name: Yerevan ZipLine Airlines
description: {'Location': ['Yerevan Zipline Airlines offers an exhilarating ziplining experience, featuring one of the longest ziplines in the region and uniquely passing under a bridge.', 'The first line stretches approximately 870 meters, reaching heights up to 123 meters, while the second line is about 650 meters long with a height of 60 meters. Riders can reach speeds between 120-130 km/h, providing a thrilling adventure over the Hrazdan Gorge.'], 'Key Features': ['Safety: Operates with strict adherence to international safety standards.', 'Unique Experience: The only zipline globally that passes beneath a bridge.', 'Duration: Each ride lasts just over a minute, offering panoramic views of Yerevan.'], 'Visiting Tips': ['Operating Hours: Open daily from 10:30 AM to 7:30 PM.', 'Address: 114/1 V. Papazyan Street, Yerevan, Armenia.', 'Contact: For reservations or inquiries, call +374 43 409090.']}
short_description: An adrenaline-pumping zipline adventure offering unparalleled views of Yerevan, including the unique experience of zipping beneath a bridge.

name: Yeraz Park/Winter Park
description: {'Location': ['Yeraz Park and Winter Park are two popular destinations in Yerevan, offering fun and relaxation for locals and visitors alike. Both parks provide family-friendly activities and beautiful seasonal attractions.', 'Yeraz Park is known for its role as a community gathering spot, and Winter Park is a seasonal highlight for winter activities in Armenia.'], 'Key Features': ['Yeraz Park: Large playgrounds, boat rentals, restaurants, and scenic spots.', "Winter Park: Armenia's largest outdoor ice skating rink (1800 m²), seasonal events, warm drinks, and traditional food."], 'Visiting Tips': ['Opening Hours: Open daily from 10:00 AM to 11:00 PM.', 'Address: Tbilisi Highway, 1/8, Yerevan, Armenia.', 'Contact: +374 98 740 330.']}
short_description: Yeraz Park offers fun family activities, while Winter Park transforms into a winter wonderland with ice skating and seasonal festivities.

name: Planetarium 1 Yerevan
description: {'Location': ['Planetarium 1 Yerevan offers immersive films about the universe, star formation, planets, astronautics, and space technology.', 'Opened on January 1, 2020, it is the first planetarium in Armenia, aiming to popularize astronomy and space science.'], 'Services & Facilities': ['Dome: 14-meter geodesic dome.', 'Seating: Removable seating for up to 50 visitors.', 'Programs: Educational films and interactive sessions about space.'], 'Operating Hours': ['Operating Hours: Open daily from 11:00 AM to 10:00 PM.', 'Address: English Park, Khorenatsi Street 22/2, Yerevan.', 'Contact: +374 96 203 235.', 'Tickets: Available on-site or via their official website.']}
short_description: Planetarium 1 Yerevan provides an immersive experience into the cosmos, making it a must-visit for astronomy enthusiasts and curious minds.

name: Yerevan Skate Park
description: {'Information': ['Yerevan Skate Park, located in the 6th section of Circular Park, is perfect for skateboarding, biking, and self-driving enthusiasts. It’s near Saint Gregory the Illuminator Cathedral and the Taras Shevchenko Monument.', "Constructed in 2021 through the generous donation of the Armenian community of Ukraine and their leader, Vilen Shatvoryan, the park is a modern addition to Yerevan's recreational spaces."], 'Key Features': ['Design: Features high-quality surfaces for various skating disciplines.', "Amphitheater: Located on the eastern side, enhancing the park's appeal.", 'Amenities: A nearby skate rental point and Skate.am store for all your gear needs.'], 'Visiting Tips': ['Operating Hours: Open daily.', 'Skate Gear: Rent gear at the Skate.am store for a more convenient experience.']}
short_description: A modern and vibrant skate park offering free access, located near key Yerevan landmarks.

name: Yerevan Park
description: {'Information': ['Yerevan Park is Armenia’s first theme park, offering top-quality attractions and high safety standards for families and thrill-seekers.', 'Opened to provide a world-class amusement experience, the park is designed to create lasting memories while promoting a green environment.'], 'Key Features': ['Various thrill rides and family attractions.', 'Indoor and outdoor entertainment areas.', 'Green spaces and dining options.'], 'Visiting Tips': ['Monday - Friday: 2:00 PM - 10:00 PM', 'Saturday - Sunday: 12:00 PM - 10:00 PM', 'Weekdays are less crowded than weekends.']}
short_description: Armenia's first theme park, offering exciting rides and a family-friendly atmosphere.

name: HOLY MOTHER OF GOD RUSSIAN ORTHODOX CHURCH OF KANAKER
description: {'Information': ['The Church of the Intercession of the Holy Mother of God, also known as the Russian Orthodox Church of Kanaker, is an active Russian Orthodox church located in the Kanaker-Zeytun District of Yerevan, Armenia.'], 'Historical Importance': ['Constructed between 1913 and 1916, the church was built to serve the Russian military personnel stationed in the area during the Russian Empire period. It was designed by architect Fyodor Verzhbitsky following a standard plan for military churches of that era. After being closed during the Soviet period, it was reopened in 1991 and renovated in 2000.'], 'Key Features': ['Architectural Style: The church showcases traditional Russian Orthodox architectural elements, including a prominent central dome and bell tower.', 'Interior: Features typical Orthodox Christian iconography and design.', 'Significance: Serves as the main church of the Russian Orthodox community in Armenia.'], 'Visiting Tips': ['Location: 68 Zakaria Kanakertsi Street, Kanaker-Zeytun District, Yerevan.', 'Dress Code: Modest attire is recommended when visiting.', "Access: The church is active and open to visitors; it's advisable to check service times to plan your visit accordingly."]}
short_description: A historic Russian Orthodox church in Yerevan's Kanaker district, reflecting early 20th-century architecture.

name: ST. GREGORY THE ILLUMINATOR CATHEDRAL OF YEREVAN
description: {'Information': ['The largest Armenian Apostolic church in Yerevan, built to commemorate Armenia’s adoption of Christianity as a state religion in 301 AD.'], 'Historical Importance': ["Named after St. Gregory the Illuminator, who converted Armenia to Christianity, the cathedral was completed in 2001 for the 1700th anniversary of Armenia's Christianization."], 'Key Features': ['Three massive churches forming a grand architectural complex.', 'Houses relics of St. Gregory the Illuminator.', 'Stunning modern Armenian architecture with traditional elements.'], 'Visiting Tips': ['Modest clothing is recommended.', 'Best visited in the morning for a peaceful experience.']}
short_description: A grand cathedral honoring Armenia’s Christian heritage, with impressive architecture and sacred relics.

name: Blue Mosque, Yerevan
description: {'Information': ['Located in the heart of Yerevan, the Blue Mosque is the only active mosque in Armenia, known for its Persian architectural influence.'], 'Historical Importance': ['Built in the 18th century during Persian rule, the mosque was a major religious and cultural center for the Persian community in Yerevan. After Soviet secularization, it was later restored and reopened with support from Iran.'], 'Key Features': ['Elegant Persian-style blue-tiled dome and minaret.', 'Peaceful courtyard with gardens and fountains.', 'Houses a library and an exhibition hall.'], 'Visiting Tips': ['Modest clothing is recommended.', 'Open to visitors except during prayer times.']}
short_description: Yerevan's only active mosque, showcasing Persian architecture and a serene atmosphere.

description: {'Location': ['21 Tumanyan Street, Yerevan, Armenia.'], 'Services & Facilities': ['Accommodation: Air-conditioned rooms with lake and city views, equipped with flat-screen TVs, desks, kettles, minibars, refrigerators, and private bathrooms with showers. Some rooms include kitchens with microwaves and stovetops.', 'Dining: Continental breakfast available each morning.', 'Additional Amenities: 24-hour front desk, room service, free Wi-Fi throughout the property, and a terrace.'], 'Check-in & Check-out': ['Check-in: From 2:00 PM.', 'Check-out: By 12:00 PM.'], 'Nearby Attractions': ['Republic Square', 'National History Museum of Armenia', 'Yerevan Zoo']}

name: Tufenkian Historic Yerevan Hotel
description: {'Location': ['48 Hanrapetutyan Street, Yerevan, Armenia.'], 'Services & Facilities': ['Accommodation: 83 luxurious rooms and suites featuring elegant interiors with traditional Armenian furniture and Tufenkian handwoven carpets.', 'Dining: The "Kharpert" restaurant offers Armenian and Italian cuisine in an elegant setting with live jazz music.', 'Relaxation & Entertainment: Seasonal outdoor pool, fitness center, and a live carpet weaving demonstration in the hotel’s gallery.', 'Additional Services: Free Wi-Fi, 24-hour front desk, and airport transfer service upon request.'], 'Check-in & Check-out': ['Check-in: From 2:00 PM.', 'Check-out: By 12:00 PM.'], 'Nearby Attractions': ['Republic Square', 'National History Museum of Armenia', 'Yerevan Zoo.']}
short_description: Tufenkian Historic Yerevan Hotel blends history and modernity, offering comfort near cultural landmarks.

name: Dynasty Hotel & SPA
description: {'Location': ['52 Hovsep Emin Street, Arabkir, Yerevan, Armenia.'], 'Services & Facilities': ['Accommodation: 52 rooms of various categories, all equipped with electronic room access systems, safes, high-quality furniture, bathrooms with necessary accessories, cable TV, and high-speed Wi-Fi with unlimited device connection.', 'Dining: An on-site restaurant offering a variety of local and international dishes.', 'Wellness: A Hammam & Spa facility, providing relaxation and rejuvenation services.', 'Additional Amenities: Secure parking, 24-hour front desk, laundry services, and a conference room for business events.'], 'Check-in & Check-out': ['Check-in: From 2:00 PM.', 'Check-out: By 12:00 PM.'], 'Nearby Attractions': ['Republic Square', 'National History Museum of Armenia', 'Yerevan Zoo.']}

name: Grand Hotel Yerevan - Small Luxury Hotels of the World
description: {'Location': ['14 Abovyan Street, Yerevan, Armenia.'], 'Services & Facilities': ['Accommodation: 104 elegantly designed rooms and suites, blending 1920s architecture with contemporary comforts.', 'Dining: Nairi Restaurant offers Italian and Armenian cuisine with views of Charles Aznavour Square; Dolce Vita Bar and Winter Garden provide live classical music and a selection of beverages.', 'Wellness: YSPA features a full-service spa, sauna, solarium, gym, and a seasonal rooftop outdoor pool.', 'Additional Amenities: Free Wi-Fi, 24-hour front desk, concierge services, and proximity to cultural sites like the National Art Gallery and Yerevan Opera Theatre.'], 'Check-in & Check-out': ['Check-in: From 2:00 PM.', 'Check-out: By 12:00 PM.'], 'Nearby Attractions': ['Republic Square.', 'National History Museum of Armenia', 'Cascade Complex.']}
short_description: Grand Hotel Yerevan combines historical elegance with modern luxury, offering refined accommodations, exquisite dining, and a serene spa, all within walking distance of Yerevan's cultural landmarks.
